channel.title: Motivation :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this chapter, we will learn to further decompose statements in terms of their verbs (called predicates) and their nouns (called individuals). This leads to predicate logic (also called first-order logic). As a motivation of why we want more expressive power, suppose we wanted to translate the following statements to propositional logic: All humans are mortal. Socrates is a human. Socrates is mortal.
